column3:
So
can be used in strings for a word-wrap and will be replaced by it? Seems like a very good solution. Only question I have left is, if we can set a default width of tooltips. Try it with the current version, if you hover the lock-icon if your wallet is encrypted. This is rich text, but looks kind of ugly, because of the small width of the tooltip.
I'm not sure where it gets the default width from (which is indeed extremely narrow). Couldn't find any documentation about that. That leaves looking in the Qt source I guess...\n
But you could verify that the default is to narrow, so this is no Win specific behaviour?\n

No, it isn't specific to any OS. This seems to make the tooltips wider (crazily wide, in this case), for example:

```
app.setStyleSheet("QToolTip { min-width: 500px; }");
```
I've added a min-width of 350px, this looks like a nice tradeoff between too narrow and too wide.\n
Tried it and it's way better than before, I agree it's a nice tradeoff until we comeup with a even nicer solution in the future :).\n
Shouldn't worry too much about this, there's way more serious issues to solve first.\n
This should get in 0.6.1 as the detach db tooltip is quite long ;).\n

No, I don't think it's a good idea to merge this between release candidates. That's only for critical bugfixes. There's the possibility that this introduces problems in some place / language so it needs testing. Better to merge it after 0.6.1.\n
It was targetted for 0.6.1 and I reminded of that fact ;). There are quite a few commits that could have been merged in before the RC1.\n
This makes tooltip windows too wide sometimes:\nhttp://luke.dashjr.org/tmp/screenshots/snapshot82.png\n

Yea, it only works if a minimum width is set, otherwise it makes them too
narrow.  Qt can either size the boxes to the text or the text to the boxes,
not both.
Rebased, and added a useful heuristic to only do this for _long_ tooltips, where "long" is defined as longer than a certain length in characters. This fixes @luke-jr's issue.\n
